text:
Renate Maria Dorrestein (25 January 1954 – 4 May 2018) was a Dutch writer, journalist and feminist. She won the "Annie Romein" prize in 1993. She started working as a journalist for a magazine called "Panorama". She published her first novel ("Buitenstaanders") in 1983. She was born in Amsterdam.
Dorrestein died on 4 May 2018 of esophageal cancer in Amsterdam at the age of 64.
